marketNews.title: DHE SDA Revised, Government Provides Flexibility
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Monday (17/2) officially issued Government Regulation No. 8/2025 requiring the placement of all foreign exchange from natural resource export (DHE SDA) within the country for one year. The policy becomes effective on 1 March 2025. The new regulation does not apply to the oil and gas sector, where the implementation of DHE SDA placement will still refer to Government Regulation No. 36/2023 with a placement of 30 percent for three months. President Prabowo estimates that the revision will increase foreign exchange stored in domestic banks by 80 billion US dollars by the end of 2025 or more than 100 billion US dollars within twelve months from implementation. The revision aims to increase the supply of foreign exchange to ease the rupiah's pressure against the US dollar recently. Although the share and tenor increase, the revision gives exporters the ability to use foreign exchange placed in a special account for several purposes, namely: 1) conversion to rupiah in the same bank for business operations; 2) payment of tax obligations, state revenue, and other obligations to the government; 3) payment of dividends in foreign currency; 4) payment for procurement of goods and services not yet available domestically; 5) repayment of loans for capital goods procurement in foreign currency. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said the government will ensure that the DHE SDA policy does not cause disruption for companies. Several association representatives indicated they do not object to the new regulation. According to the Executive Director of the Indonesia Mining Association, Hendra Sinadia, the revision gives exporters room to maintain cash flow. Key Takeaway: The revision of DHE SDA placement potentially provides positive sentiment for banking issuers due to added foreign exchange liquidity. With flexibility allowing the use of export foreign exchange for operational and financial needs, we assess that the revision does not have a too significant impact on the continuity of natural resource exporters' businesses. Bloomberg consensus expects Bank Indonesia to keep the BI Rate at 5.75 percent in the Governor Board meeting on Wednesday (19/2). The House of Representatives on Tuesday (18/2) passed an amendment to the Mining Law, aiming to increase downstream processing and access for religious community organizations and MSMEs. The amendment allows priority access for mining concessions to companies that intend to build processing facilities, considering investment size, added value, and job creation. It also allows religious community organizations and MSMEs priority access to certain mining areas, previously granted only to state-owned enterprises. Universities were previously included but were removed in the final draft. Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday (17/2) led a meeting with leading Chinese entrepreneurs, including Alibaba founder Jack Ma. Bloomberg reported that this indicates a return of Chinese government support for the private sector to revive the economy after a series of crackdowns in 2020, although the extent of policy change remains unclear. Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak on Monday (17/2) said OPEC+ is not considering delaying the monthly oil supply increase scheduled to start in April 2025. The statement came after Bloomberg reported that OPEC+ was reviewing a possible delay despite a request from US President Donald Trump to lower oil prices. Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi on Tuesday (18/2) said the ministry is studying the implementation of a 50 percent biodiesel blend (B50) in 2026 and also targeting a 3 percent CPO blend for jet fuel in 2026. Nikkei Asia reported that Apple is discussing with several suppliers the possibility of establishing an iPhone factory in Indonesia, driven by a ban on iPhone 16 sales in Indonesia since October 2024 due to the lack of a domestic component certificate (TKDN). If built, Indonesia would become the second Southeast Asian country after Vietnam with iPhone production facilities. Humpuss Maritim Internasional ($HUMI) through its subsidiary PT Hutama Trans Kencana purchased one oil tanker from PT Patria Nusasegara for 7.05 million US dollars. The transaction is intended for the development of the fuel oil distribution business. The Indonesia Stock Exchange temporarily halted trading of Wijaya Karya ($WIKA) after the company announced a postponement of principal payments on sukuk and bonds due on 18 February 2025. The exchange said the announcement indicated problems with the company's business continuity. Previously, WIKA had proposed partial repayment and an extension of the remaining principal of bonds and sukuk mudharabah for two years, but the relevant committees could not reach a decision on the proposal.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Announces Increased Buyback Allocation to Rp1.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia announced a change of the maximum fund allocation for share buyback, increasing it from 905 billion rupiah to 1.5 trillion rupiah. The RUPST schedule to approve this corporate action will remain on 26 March 2025. The buyback will be carried out within twelve months after receiving RUPST approval, and the shares acquired will be transferred for an employee and/or director and commissioner ownership program.

tickerNews.title: BTPS Reports Strong Q4 2024 Net Profit and Revenue Figures
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah recorded net profit of 291 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+278 percent YoY, +33 percent QoQ), resulting in a 2024 net profit of 1.1 trillion rupiah (minus 1.8 percent YoY). The result was supported by after-distribution profit-sharing revenue of 1.2 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (minus 7.9 percent YoY, +0.5 percent QoQ), making the 2024 after-distribution revenue 4.9 trillion rupiah (minus 7 percent YoY). Additionally, provision expense fell to 251 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (minus 64 percent YoY, minus 35 percent QoQ), causing 2024 provision expense to decline 28 percent YoY to 1.4 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: EXCL Merger Targeted for Completion in April 2025
tickerNews.content: Smartfren Telecom beneficiary Franky Widjaja said the merger of XL Axiata and FREN is targeted to be completed in April 2025. He mentioned that his side is currently handling the merger process with relevant authorities, including OJK and the Ministry of Communication and Digital.

tickerNews.title: INDY Refutes Coal Divestment Rumors and Confirms Gold Mine Timeline
tickerNews.content: Indika Energy President Director Arsjad Rasjid said the company has no plan to divest the coal mining assets managed by PT Kideco Jaya Agung. He noted that rumors of divestment have circulated since early 2025, and the company will consider carefully any coal asset divestment plans. He also confirmed that the Awak Mas gold mine project, expected to have a production capacity of 100,000 troy ounces per year, will start production in 2026.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Controlling Shareholder Purchases 14.4 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo controlling shareholder and President Commissioner Soegiarto Adikoesoemo bought approximately 14.4 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,068 rupiah per share between 12-14 February 2025. The transaction value was about 15.4 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Soegiarto's direct ownership in AKRA increased from 0.574 percent to 0.646 percent.

tickerNews.title: RAAM Controlling Shareholder Increases Stake by 0.13 Percentage Points
tickerNews.content: Tripar Multivision Plus controlling shareholder and President Commissioner Ram Jethmal Punjabi bought about 8.8 million RAAM shares at an average price of 329 rupiah per share between 11-14 February 2025. The transaction value was about 2.9 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Ram's direct ownership rose from 70.34 percent to 70.47 percent.

tickerNews.title: BDMN Reports 2024 Net Profit Decline and Provision Increase
tickerNews.content: Bank Danamon Indonesia reported net profit of 848 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (minus 10 percent YoY, minus 3 percent QoQ), leading to a 2024 net profit of 3.2 trillion rupiah (minus 9 percent YoY). On the top line, Net Interest Income grew to 3.9 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (plus 0.1 percent YoY, plus 2 percent QoQ), making 2024 NII grow 2 percent YoY to 15.6 trillion rupiah. Meanwhile, provision expense rose to 1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (plus 2 percent YoY, plus 7 percent QoQ), causing 2024 provision expense to increase 19 percent YoY to 4.4 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: DCII Explores Stock Split and Expands Data Center Projects
tickerNews.content: DCI Indonesia President Director Otto Toto Sugiri said the company is exploring a stock split, without further details. He also mentioned that DCII will focus on completing a data center project valued at 11 trillion rupiah in Surabaya, East Java. The data center has a capacity of 9 MW and is targeted for completion early 2026. Additionally, DCII is completing a 36 MW data center in Cibitung.
